thread.title: Katie Hopkins to lead pro-Brexit demo through Exeter city centre today

author: Abbie Bray
title: Katie Hopkins to lead pro-Brexit demo through Exeter city centre today
text:
Abbie Bray What's On Reporter 09:00, 1 DEC 2018 Katie Hopkins outside Exeter Magistrates Court (Image: Twitter) Get Daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Katie Hopkins will lead a Brexit protest through Exeter city centre today.
The message the controversial motor-mouth wants to spread is 'dig deep for Brexit' as passionate Brexiteers encourage Leave voters not to give up on Brexit.
The rally is set to take place at midday outside The White Company on Exeter High Street. It will then proceed to Western Way and on to the quay. Read More Are you breaking the law when you defrost your car?
Alison Sheridan, UKIP chairman for Exeter and representative of Leave Means Leave said: “Theresa May has not got us a deal. The word deal is a deceit. She has surrendered our sovereignty to the EU.
"We will still be in the single market still be in the customs Union, still be forced to comply with European rules without having a say on what those will be, and will only be allowed to leave if the EU agrees. And we will pay £60 billion pounds for the pleasure. As Nigel says, It is the worst deal in history." Katie Hopkins causes controversy again Read More Police hit back after Katie Hopkins likens force volunteers to 'Sharia patrols'
“We need people to dig deep for Brexit, the Brexit they actually voted for. Which is to actually Leave the EU."
Much of the South West voted to leave the EU. Voters in North, Mid, East Devon, Plymouth, Teignbridge, Torbay, Torridge and West Devon voted to Leave.
Watch a video below on the worst things Katie Hopkins has said Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
Exeter itself voted to remain in the EU.
Brexiteers say this rally will be a moment of unity in what has been a very divisive time for Britain and for political parties on the left and right.
There will be representatives from Leave Means Leave, UKIP, the Tory Party, For Britain and Fishing for Leave to show they speak with one voice on their aim: a no-deal Brexit. Read More
